author: 4d8c
content: Another way of putting it might be can we make the system useful and valuable for users without pricing them out?

author: sky.cactus
content: We can increase supply (stuff is being worked on to enable this like state expiry, layer 2s, regenesis, portal network, etc.).

author: 4d8c
content: Sure, but doesn't this hold regardless of supply?

author: 4d8c
content: as in any measure will be temporary if its just capacity increase

author: sky.cactus
content: One can imagine a supply that is large enough that everyone can transact as much as they desire and there is still space left.

author: 4d8c
content: So profit opportunities will cap out at some point?

author: sky.cactus
content: We cannot predict how much supply is "enough", but we can assert that there does exist some level of supply that matches demand.

author: sky.cactus
content: Again, I think calling this "profit opportunity" is the wrong mental model.  It is a simple economic supply/demand curve intersection problem.

author: sky.cactus
content: There is demand for blockspace by users (for any reason), and there is a supply of blockspace.  An increase in fees decreases demand, as people are no longer interested in utilizing the network at a higher price.  An increase of supply results in a decrease in fees due to the auto-adjustment algorithm.

author: 4d8c
content: Sure, so you are assuming demand is limited?

author: 4d8c
content: or rather there is a world where supply is large enough for any demand?

author: sky.cactus
content: If you want to continue discussing this the conversation should really be moved over to <#692078615269212180>.

author: roguedealer3678
content: Struggling to get onto someone from EF — we’re looking to host ETHDownUnder 2022 — Australia — near Uluru [middle of Australia] — can anyone point me in the right direction. Sorry for using Eth r&D discord for this. I too hate noise pollution haha

author: timbeiko
content: https://esp.ethereum.foundation/en/ is probably the best place to get help!
